response_metadata.response_text:
{
"overview": "This bill transfers the Hawaii Broadband and Digital Equity Office from the Department of Business, Economic Development, and Tourism to the Office of Enterprise Technology Services in the Department of Accounting and General Services. [CHUNK_35] It also establishes the Hawaii Broadband and Digital Equity Special Fund. [CHUNK_35] The measure appropriates funds to support the office and the newly created special fund. [CHUNK_35]",
"appropriations": "There is appropriated out of the general revenues of the State of Hawaii the sum of $200,000 (HB934_.HTM.txt) or so much thereof as may be necessary for fiscal year 2025-2026 to be deposited into the broadband and digital equity special fund. [CHUNK_21] There is also appropriated out of the broadband and digital equity special fund the sum of $200,000 (HB934_.HTM.txt) or so much thereof as may be necessary for fiscal year 2025-2026 for the purposes of the fund. [CHUNK_22] The sum appropriated shall be expended by the Hawaii broadband and digital equity office for the purposes of this Act. [CHUNK_23]",
"assumptions_and_methodology": "The provided legislative documents do not specify the assumptions, cost estimation methods, or data sources used to calculate the financial projections for this measure. [CHUNK_0] The bill appropriates specific amounts for fiscal year 2025-2026 without detailing the underlying methodology for these figures. [CHUNK_21] No references to comparable programs or historical budgets are included in the text to explain the basis for the appropriation amounts. [CHUNK_0]",
"agency_impact": "All rights, powers, functions, and duties of the department of business, economic development, and tourism relating to the Hawaii broadband and digital equity office are transferred to the department of accounting and general services. [CHUNK_24] Employees who occupy civil service positions and whose functions are transferred shall retain their civil service status, whether permanent or temporary. [CHUNK_25] All appropriations, records, equipment, machines, files, supplies, contracts, books, papers, documents, maps, and other personal property will also be transferred with the functions to which they relate. [CHUNK_31, CHUNK_32]",
"economic_impact": "The Hawaii broadband and digital equity office shall develop and implement specific strategies and plans to aggressively increase broadband affordability, penetration, and competitive availability in the State. [CHUNK_5] The office will support the efforts of both public and private entities to enhance or facilitate the deployment of and access to competitively priced, advanced electronic communications services. [CHUNK_6] It will also administer grant programs in support of broadband infrastructure, innovation, and the digital economy. [CHUNK_8]",
"policy_impact": "This measure transfers the Hawaii Broadband and Digital Equity Office from the Department of Business, Economic Development, and Tourism to the Office of Enterprise Technology Services. [CHUNK_34] The bill establishes the Hawaii Broadband and Digital Equity Special Fund to be administered by the Hawaii broadband and digital equity office. [CHUNK_17] Additionally, the bill repeals Chapter 206S, Hawaii Revised Statutes. [CHUNK_21]",
"revenue_sources": "The broadband and digital equity special fund will be deposited with proceeds of leases of broadband infrastructure owned by the State, appropriations by the legislature, and gifts, donations, and grants from public agencies and private persons. [CHUNK_17, CHUNK_18] This bill appropriates $200,000 (HB934_.HTM.txt) out of the general revenues of the State of Hawaii for fiscal year 2025-2026 for deposit into the fund. [CHUNK_21] All interest earned or accrued on moneys deposited into the special fund shall become a part of the special fund. [CHUNK_18]",
"six_year_fiscal_implications": "For fiscal year 2025-2026, the bill appropriates $200,000 (HB934_.HTM.txt) from general revenues to be deposited into the broadband and digital equity special fund. [CHUNK_21] An additional sum of $200,000 (HB934_.HTM.txt) is appropriated out of the special fund for the same fiscal year. [CHUNK_22] The special fund is intended for ongoing uses, including supporting broadband projects, defraying internet service costs, and funding personnel positions. [CHUNK_19] Future revenues for the fund may come from legislative appropriations, leases of state-owned broadband infrastructure, and grants or donations. [CHUNK_17, CHUNK_18] The transfer of employees will occur without loss of salary, seniority, or other benefits. [CHUNK_25] However, the bill does not provide a fiscal projection for the subsequent five years. [CHUNK_0] The comptroller may prescribe the duties and qualifications of transferred employees and fix their salaries without regard to chapter 76, Hawaii Revised Statutes. [CHUNK_30] Subsequent changes in employee status may be made pursuant to applicable civil service and compensation laws. [CHUNK_27] The provided text does not contain information about program expansion or recurring expenses beyond the initial appropriation. [CHUNK_0] Therefore, the specific fiscal implications beyond fiscal year 2025-2026 are indeterminate. [CHUNK_0]",
"operating_revenue_impact": "The measure establishes the broadband and digital equity special fund, which will receive revenues. [CHUNK_17] These revenues include proceeds of leases of broadband infrastructure owned by the State, as well as gifts, donations, and grants from public agencies and private persons. [CHUNK_18] All interest earned or accrued on moneys deposited into the special fund shall become a part of the special fund. [CHUNK_18]",
"capital_expenditure_impact": "The provided documents do not outline any specific new capital expenditures. [CHUNK_0] Moneys in the broadband and digital equity special fund shall be used for supporting broadband projects, but details on capital investments are not provided. [CHUNK_19] The bill mandates the transfer of existing equipment, machines, and other personal property, but does not appropriate funds for new capital purchases. [CHUNK_31]",
"fiscal_implications_after_6_years": "The ongoing fiscal obligations after six years will depend on future legislative appropriations and the office's ability to actively seek out funding from public and private sources. [CHUNK_9] The broadband and digital equity special fund is established as a continuing funding mechanism for its designated purposes. [CHUNK_19] The long-term fiscal sustainability of the office and its projects will rely on revenues generated from leases, grants, donations, and any future appropriations. [CHUNK_17, CHUNK_18]",
"updates_from_previous_fiscal_note": "The provided documents do not contain a previous fiscal note for this measure. [CHUNK_0] Therefore, a summary of updates or changes cannot be provided. [CHUNK_0]"
}

chunk_details.chunk_text: HB934 HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES H.B. NO. 934 THIRTY-THIRD LEGISLATURE, 2025 STATE OF HAWAII A BILL FOR AN ACT relating to the hawaii broadband and digital equity office . BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF HAWAII: SECTION 1. Chapter 27, Hawaii Revised Statutes, is amended by adding

1. Chapter 27, Hawaii Revised Statutes, is amended by adding a new part to be appropriately designated and to read as follows: " Part . Hawaii broadband and digital equity office § 27-A Definitions. As used in this part: "Broadband" means high-speed internet access that is always on, including mobile

means high-speed internet access that is always on, including mobile and fixed technologies. "Digital equity" means a condition in which all individuals and communities have the information technology capacity needed for full participation in society, democracy, and the economy. § 27-B Hawaii broadband and digital equity office; establishment; strategic broadband

27-B Hawaii broadband and digital equity office; establishment; strategic broadband coordinator; staff. (a) There is established the Hawaii broadband and digital equity office within the office of enterprise technology services. (b) Without regard to section 26-34, the governor shall appoint a strategic broadband coordinator, who shall be exempt from chapter

a strategic broadband coordinator, who shall be exempt from chapter 76, to head the Hawaii broadband and digital equity office. §27-C Hawaii broadband and digital equity office; duties. In furtherance of the State's objectives and policies for the economy pursuant to section 226-10.5, the Hawaii broadband and digital equity office

to section 226-10.5, the Hawaii broadband and digital equity office shall: (1) Develop and implement specific strategies and plans to aggressively increase broadband affordability, penetration, and competitive availability in the State; (2) Support the efforts of both public and private entities in the State to enhance or facilitate the deployment

entities in the State to enhance or facilitate the deployment of and access to competitively priced, advanced electronic communications services, including broadband and its products and services and internet access services of general application throughout the State; (3) Promote the landing of trans-Pacific submarine cable, including the development of a

landing of trans-Pacific submarine cable, including the development of a shared access cable station and associated terrestrial connectivity to reduce barriers to fiber landing in Hawaii; (4) Promote, advocate, and facilitate the implementation of the findings and recommendations of the Hawaii broadband task force established by Act 2, First Special

Hawaii broadband task force established by Act 2, First Special Session Laws of Hawaii 2007, and the 2020 Hawaii Broadband Strategic Plan; (5) Support the findings of community-based groups as reflected in its digital equity declaration; (6) Administer grant programs in support of broadband infrastructure, innovation, and the digital economy;

in support of broadband infrastructure, innovation, and the digital economy; (7) Actively seek out funding from public and private sources in furtherance of the office's duties pursuant to this section; and (8) Provide a repository, aggregation point, and governance framework for broadband mapping and digital equity data from various sources,

for broadband mapping and digital equity data from various sources, including digital literacy, telehealth, distance education, remote work, internet accessibility, and service coverage to support mapping, reporting, infrastructure deployment, and data-driven policy. §27-D Broadband planning and coordination; cooperation. (a) The Hawaii broadband and digital equity office shall: (1) Seek input

Hawaii broadband and digital equity office shall: (1) Seek input and the widest possible cooperation from public and private agencies and individuals to achieve the purposes of this part; (2) Work closely with and assist the counties in the promotion of coordinated state and county broadband planning; (3) Encourage every

of coordinated state and county broadband planning; (3) Encourage every state department, county agency, and other public or private agencies and individuals involved in broadband programs to participate in the activities of the office and incorporate, to the extent feasible, the ideas and suggestions of the participants in the office's

the ideas and suggestions of the participants in the office's comprehensive planning goals; (4) Monitor the broadband-based development efforts of other states and nations in areas such as business, education, and health; (5) Advise the office of enterprise technology services on other states' best practices involving remote work promotion and

on other states' best practices involving remote work promotion and policies and strategies related to making affordable broadband services available to every home and business in the State; (6) Monitor broadband-related activities at the federal level; (7) Encourage public-private partnerships to increase the deployment and adoption of broadband services and

to increase the deployment and adoption of broadband services and applications; (8) Monitor regulatory and policy changes for potential impact on broadband deployment and sustainability in the State; and (9) Advise the chief information officer on broadband deployment. (b) Nothing in this section shall be construed to delegate, or detract

in this section shall be construed to delegate, or detract in any way from, the functions, powers, and duties conferred by law or rule on any department or agency of the State or county. § 27-E Broadband and digital equity special fund. (a) There is established in the state treasure

special fund. (a) There is established in the state treasure the broadband and digital equity special fund to be administered by the Hawaii broadband and digital equity office, into which shall be deposited: (1) Proceeds of leases of broadband infrastructure owned by the State; (2) Appropriations by the legislature to

owned by the State; (2) Appropriations by the legislature to the special fund; and (3) Gifts, donations, and grants from public agencies and private persons. All interest earned or accrued on moneys deposited into the special fund shall become a part of the special fund. (b) Moneys in the broadband

part of the special fund. (b) Moneys in the broadband and digital equity special fund shall be used for: (1) Supporting broadband projects; (2) Defraying the cost of internet services; and (3) Funding positions for personnel to provide technical assistance to the community. (c) Expenditures from the broadband and digital

to the community. (c) Expenditures from the broadband and digital equity special fund shall be made by the Hawaii broadband and digital equity office, subject to oversight and prior approval by the information technology steering committee." SECTION 2. Chapter 206S, Hawaii Revised Statutes, is repealed. SECTION 3 . There is

Hawaii Revised Statutes, is repealed. SECTION 3 . There is appropriated out of the general revenues of the State of Hawaii the sum of $200,000 or so much thereof as may be necessary for fiscal year 2025-2026 to be deposited into the broadband and digital equity special fund under section

into the broadband and digital equity special fund under section 27-E, Hawaii Revised Statutes . SECTION 4 . There is appropriated out of the br oadband and digital equity special fund the sum of $200,000 or so much thereof as may be necessary for fiscal year 2025-2026 for the purposes

may be necessary for fiscal year 2025-2026 for the purposes of the fund. The sum appropriated shall be expended by the Hawaii broadband and digital equity office for the purposes of this Act. SECTION 5. All rights, powers, functions, and duties of the department of business, economic development, and tourism

duties of the department of business, economic development, and tourism relating to the Hawaii broadband and digital equity office are transferred to the department of accounting and general services. All employees who occupy civil service positions and whose functions are transferred to the department of accounting and general services by

transferred to the department of accounting and general services by this Act shall retain their civil service status, whether permanent or temporary. Employees shall be transferred without loss of salary, seniority (except as prescribed by applicable collective bargaining agreements), retention points, prior service credit, any vacation and sick leave credits

points, prior service credit, any vacation and sick leave credits previously earned, and other rights, benefits, and privileges, in accordance with state personnel laws and this Act; provided that the employees possess the minimum qualifications and public employment requirements for the class or position to which transferred or appointed, as

the class or position to which transferred or appointed, as applicable; provided further that subsequent changes in status may be made pursuant to applicable civil service and compensation laws. Any employee who, prior to this Act, is exempt from civil service and is transferred as a consequence of this Act

service and is transferred as a consequence of this Act may retain the employee's exempt status, but shall not be appointed to a civil service position as a consequence of this Act. An exempt employee who is transferred by this Act shall not suffer any loss of prior service credit,

Act shall not suffer any loss of prior service credit, vacation or sick leave credits previously earned, or other employee benefits or privileges as a consequence of this Act; provided that the employees possess legal and public employment requirements for the position to which transferred or appointed, as applicable; provided

the position to which transferred or appointed, as applicable; provided further that subsequent changes in status may be made pursuant to applicable employment and compensation laws. The comptroller may prescribe the duties and qualifications of these employees and fix their salaries without regard to chapter 76, Hawaii Revised Statutes. SECTION

salaries without regard to chapter 76, Hawaii Revised Statutes. SECTION 6. All appropriations, records, equipment, machines, files, supplies, contracts, books, papers, documents, maps, and other personal property heretofore made, used, acquired, or held by the department of business, economic development, and tourism relating to the functions of the Hawaii broadband

and tourism relating to the functions of the Hawaii broadband and digital equity office transferred to the department of accounting and general services shall be transferred with the functions to which they relate. SECTION 7. In codifying the new sections added by section 1 of this Act, the revisor of

added by section 1 of this Act, the revisor of statutes shall substitute appropriate section numbers for the letters used in designating the new sections in this Act. SECTION 8. This Act shall take effect on July 1, 2025. INTRODUCED BY: _____________________________ Report Title: Hawaii Broadband and Digital Equity Office;

BY: _____________________________ Report Title: Hawaii Broadband and Digital Equity Office; Department of Business, Economic Development, and Tourism; Office of Enterprise Technology Services; Hawaii Broadband and Digital Equity Special Fund; Appropriation Description: Transfers the Hawaii Broadband and Digital Equity Office from the Department of Business, Economic Development, and Tourism to the

the Department of Business, Economic Development, and Tourism to the Office of Enterprise Technology Services in the Department of Accounting and General Services. Establishes the Hawaii Broadband and Digital Equity Special Fund. Appropriates funds. The summary description of legislation appearing on this page is for informational purposes only and is
on this page is for informational purposes only and is not legislation or evidence of legislative intent.

SECTION 4 . There is appropriated out of the br oadband and digital equity special fund the sum of $200,000

HB934.chunk_text: HB934 HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES H.B. NO. 934 THIRTY-THIRD LEGISLATURE, 2025 STATE OF HAWAII A BILL FOR AN ACT relating to the hawaii broadband and digital equity office . BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF HAWAII: SECTION 1. Chapter 27, Hawaii Revised Statutes, is amended by adding

1. Chapter 27, Hawaii Revised Statutes, is amended by adding a new part to be appropriately designated and to read as follows: " Part . Hawaii broadband and digital equity office § 27-A Definitions. As used in this part: "Broadband" means high-speed internet access that is always on, including mobile

means high-speed internet access that is always on, including mobile and fixed technologies. "Digital equity" means a condition in which all individuals and communities have the information technology capacity needed for full participation in society, democracy, and the economy. § 27-B Hawaii broadband and digital equity office; establishment; strategic broadband

27-B Hawaii broadband and digital equity office; establishment; strategic broadband coordinator; staff. (a) There is established the Hawaii broadband and digital equity office within the office of enterprise technology services. (b) Without regard to section 26-34, the governor shall appoint a strategic broadband coordinator, who shall be exempt from chapter

a strategic broadband coordinator, who shall be exempt from chapter 76, to head the Hawaii broadband and digital equity office. §27-C Hawaii broadband and digital equity office; duties. In furtherance of the State's objectives and policies for the economy pursuant to section 226-10.5, the Hawaii broadband and digital equity office

to section 226-10.5, the Hawaii broadband and digital equity office shall: (1) Develop and implement specific strategies and plans to aggressively increase broadband affordability, penetration, and competitive availability in the State; (2) Support the efforts of both public and private entities in the State to enhance or facilitate the deployment

entities in the State to enhance or facilitate the deployment of and access to competitively priced, advanced electronic communications services, including broadband and its products and services and internet access services of general application throughout the State; (3) Promote the landing of trans-Pacific submarine cable, including the development of a

landing of trans-Pacific submarine cable, including the development of a shared access cable station and associated terrestrial connectivity to reduce barriers to fiber landing in Hawaii; (4) Promote, advocate, and facilitate the implementation of the findings and recommendations of the Hawaii broadband task force established by Act 2, First Special

Hawaii broadband task force established by Act 2, First Special Session Laws of Hawaii 2007, and the 2020 Hawaii Broadband Strategic Plan; (5) Support the findings of community-based groups as reflected in its digital equity declaration; (6) Administer grant programs in support of broadband infrastructure, innovation, and the digital economy;

in support of broadband infrastructure, innovation, and the digital economy; (7) Actively seek out funding from public and private sources in furtherance of the office's duties pursuant to this section; and (8) Provide a repository, aggregation point, and governance framework for broadband mapping and digital equity data from various sources,

for broadband mapping and digital equity data from various sources, including digital literacy, telehealth, distance education, remote work, internet accessibility, and service coverage to support mapping, reporting, infrastructure deployment, and data-driven policy. §27-D Broadband planning and coordination; cooperation. (a) The Hawaii broadband and digital equity office shall: (1) Seek input

Hawaii broadband and digital equity office shall: (1) Seek input and the widest possible cooperation from public and private agencies and individuals to achieve the purposes of this part; (2) Work closely with and assist the counties in the promotion of coordinated state and county broadband planning; (3) Encourage every

of coordinated state and county broadband planning; (3) Encourage every state department, county agency, and other public or private agencies and individuals involved in broadband programs to participate in the activities of the office and incorporate, to the extent feasible, the ideas and suggestions of the participants in the office's

the ideas and suggestions of the participants in the office's comprehensive planning goals; (4) Monitor the broadband-based development efforts of other states and nations in areas such as business, education, and health; (5) Advise the office of enterprise technology services on other states' best practices involving remote work promotion and

on other states' best practices involving remote work promotion and policies and strategies related to making affordable broadband services available to every home and business in the State; (6) Monitor broadband-related activities at the federal level; (7) Encourage public-private partnerships to increase the deployment and adoption of broadband services and

to increase the deployment and adoption of broadband services and applications; (8) Monitor regulatory and policy changes for potential impact on broadband deployment and sustainability in the State; and (9) Advise the chief information officer on broadband deployment. (b) Nothing in this section shall be construed to delegate, or detract

in this section shall be construed to delegate, or detract in any way from, the functions, powers, and duties conferred by law or rule on any department or agency of the State or county. § 27-E Broadband and digital equity special fund. (a) There is established in the state treasure

special fund. (a) There is established in the state treasure the broadband and digital equity special fund to be administered by the Hawaii broadband and digital equity office, into which shall be deposited: (1) Proceeds of leases of broadband infrastructure owned by the State; (2) Appropriations by the legislature to

owned by the State; (2) Appropriations by the legislature to the special fund; and (3) Gifts, donations, and grants from public agencies and private persons. All interest earned or accrued on moneys deposited into the special fund shall become a part of the special fund. (b) Moneys in the broadband

part of the special fund. (b) Moneys in the broadband and digital equity special fund shall be used for: (1) Supporting broadband projects; (2) Defraying the cost of internet services; and (3) Funding positions for personnel to provide technical assistance to the community. (c) Expenditures from the broadband and digital

to the community. (c) Expenditures from the broadband and digital equity special fund shall be made by the Hawaii broadband and digital equity office, subject to oversight and prior approval by the information technology steering committee." SECTION 2. Chapter 206S, Hawaii Revised Statutes, is repealed. SECTION 3 . There is

Hawaii Revised Statutes, is repealed. SECTION 3 . There is appropriated out of the general revenues of the State of Hawaii the sum of $200,000 or so much thereof as may be necessary for fiscal year 2025-2026 to be deposited into the broadband and digital equity special fund under section

into the broadband and digital equity special fund under section 27-E, Hawaii Revised Statutes . SECTION 4 . There is appropriated out of the br oadband and digital equity special fund the sum of $200,000 or so much thereof as may be necessary for fiscal year 2025-2026 for the purposes

may be necessary for fiscal year 2025-2026 for the purposes of the fund. The sum appropriated shall be expended by the Hawaii broadband and digital equity office for the purposes of this Act. SECTION 5. All rights, powers, functions, and duties of the department of business, economic development, and tourism

duties of the department of business, economic development, and tourism relating to the Hawaii broadband and digital equity office are transferred to the department of accounting and general services. All employees who occupy civil service positions and whose functions are transferred to the department of accounting and general services by

transferred to the department of accounting and general services by this Act shall retain their civil service status, whether permanent or temporary. Employees shall be transferred without loss of salary, seniority (except as prescribed by applicable collective bargaining agreements), retention points, prior service credit, any vacation and sick leave credits

points, prior service credit, any vacation and sick leave credits previously earned, and other rights, benefits, and privileges, in accordance with state personnel laws and this Act; provided that the employees possess the minimum qualifications and public employment requirements for the class or position to which transferred or appointed, as

the class or position to which transferred or appointed, as applicable; provided further that subsequent changes in status may be made pursuant to applicable civil service and compensation laws. Any employee who, prior to this Act, is exempt from civil service and is transferred as a consequence of this Act

service and is transferred as a consequence of this Act may retain the employee's exempt status, but shall not be appointed to a civil service position as a consequence of this Act. An exempt employee who is transferred by this Act shall not suffer any loss of prior service credit,

Act shall not suffer any loss of prior service credit, vacation or sick leave credits previously earned, or other employee benefits or privileges as a consequence of this Act; provided that the employees possess legal and public employment requirements for the position to which transferred or appointed, as applicable; provided

the position to which transferred or appointed, as applicable; provided further that subsequent changes in status may be made pursuant to applicable employment and compensation laws. The comptroller may prescribe the duties and qualifications of these employees and fix their salaries without regard to chapter 76, Hawaii Revised Statutes. SECTION

salaries without regard to chapter 76, Hawaii Revised Statutes. SECTION 6. All appropriations, records, equipment, machines, files, supplies, contracts, books, papers, documents, maps, and other personal property heretofore made, used, acquired, or held by the department of business, economic development, and tourism relating to the functions of the Hawaii broadband

and tourism relating to the functions of the Hawaii broadband and digital equity office transferred to the department of accounting and general services shall be transferred with the functions to which they relate. SECTION 7. In codifying the new sections added by section 1 of this Act, the revisor of

added by section 1 of this Act, the revisor of statutes shall substitute appropriate section numbers for the letters used in designating the new sections in this Act. SECTION 8. This Act shall take effect on July 1, 2025. INTRODUCED BY: _____________________________ Report Title: Hawaii Broadband and Digital Equity Office;

BY: _____________________________ Report Title: Hawaii Broadband and Digital Equity Office; Department of Business, Economic Development, and Tourism; Office of Enterprise Technology Services; Hawaii Broadband and Digital Equity Special Fund; Appropriation Description: Transfers the Hawaii Broadband and Digital Equity Office from the Department of Business, Economic Development, and Tourism to the

the Department of Business, Economic Development, and Tourism to the Office of Enterprise Technology Services in the Department of Accounting and General Services.
